main_definition: The scientific study of celestial objects, space, and the physical universe as a whole.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An idiomatic expression referring to an unattainable or far-off goal
meanings_and_examples.example: She set her sights on astronomy when she was just ten years old.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of studying the stars, planets, and other celestial bodies in relation to their positions and movements
meanings_and_examples.example: His passion for astronomy led him to spend countless nights observing the sky with a telescope.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The branch of science that deals with the study of space, celestial bodies, galaxies, and the universe as a whole
meanings_and_examples.example: Astronomy is one of the oldest sciences, dating back to ancient civilizations who used it for navigation and timekeeping.
